column4: Palintheus was assisting me. I'm the one with the issue. trying that command
hm.  and when you ran   sudo update-alternatives --config java   you made sure that the sun was selected?
have you installed any other java plugins?
ls  /usr/lib/firefox/plugins , do you see an obvious java plugin listed?
ok, ls -l /usr/lib/firefox/plugin/libjavaplugin.so , that will show you what it is linked to
now ls -l /etc/alternatives/firefox-javaplugin.so , what does that link to?
yes. That link should have been altered by the update-alternative.  try   sudo update-alternatives --config firefox-javaplugin.so
That did it. Thanks a ton!
yw. Odd that we had to go all the way around
Wife won't use ubuntu without java.
the things we put with for love :)
